DialogueText.Text: Quite the relieving discussion today I'd say! They've told us plenty of times, but its nice to be reminded that thing's will be turning out well. I had been feeling kinda antsy today... Almost reminded me of how I was found by our friends here!

I remember it quite vividly... It was during the height of Yharim's Crusade. You see, my city was founded by a goddess, Themis, which put us in their sights. As their legions attacked, our goddess sat atop her spire at the ciy's center, meaning the invaders tore through our city just to reach her... I know not how many died that day, but I had become trapped in the rubble... That's where I was found and saved.

There's no need to worry. Thanks to our friends here in the Order, I survived, and now I get to work on something... bigger, than myself. That's something I get to be proud of. To be honest, I'm much happier now than I was before my city's fall; a strange thing to say, I know.

Themis was the Goddess of Justice, and ruled over the city I once called home. If my memory serves, she was one of three to claim the souls of some infamous trio of dragons. Hers held the aspect of Power, but I can't recall the other two... After her ascension, she founded our city where she became quite famous as a judge of sorts. Those with disputes would far and wide to our humble city just for her decree on the matter. Though in the end, she died by the Godseeker's hand... A deserved end if you ask me.

The Great One, as we refer to it, has always been a somewhat... vague concept until now. We'be come so far! Its an honor to be allowed to learn of its true nature. Such a magestic thing... I look forward to its arrival greatly!

Well, I believe it will do much good for the world. The Gods... The Brimstone Witch... The Godseeker... Our lives have been dominated by these few, powerful individuals for too long! With them gone, I think we'll finally be able to live in peace. Peace... Its been far too long since our world knew peace.
Worry not, friend. Soon all shall be made right! Just you wait!
Well, it's been nice talking to you! Hope to see you next time!

If she had gone out to face the Godseeker's armies, or even just left the city, then so many lives may have been spared. Its because she chose to hide away that the Godseeker tore through our city. A God using her people as nothing more than shields...
Oh, I hope I'm not being too much of a downer! I think I'll be on my way now. Hope to see you again! It was nice chatting with you; even if it was about some less than pleasant stuff.
